D3-LFP.name: Local File Permissions
D3-LFP.desc: Restricting access to a local file by configuring operating system functionality.

D3-MAC.name: Mandatory Access Control
D3-MAC.desc: Controlling access to local computer system resources with kernel-level capabilities.

D3-DAM.name: Domain Account Monitoring
D3-DAM.desc: Monitoring the existence of or changes to Domain User Accounts.

D3-LAM.name: Local Account Monitoring
D3-LAM.desc: Analyzing local user accounts to detect unauthorized activity.

D3-SPP.name: Strong Password Policy
D3-SPP.desc: Modifying system configuration to increase password strength.

D3-SCP.name: System Configuration Permissions
D3-SCP.desc: Restricting system configuration modifications to a specific user or group of users.

D3-ANCI.name: Authentication Cache Invalidation
D3-ANCI.desc: Removing tokens or credentials from an authentication cache to prevent further user associated account accesses.

D3-DTP.name: Domain Trust Policy
D3-DTP.desc: Restricting inter-domain trust by modifying domain configuration.

D3-UAP.name: User Account Permissions
D3-UAP.desc: Restricting a user account's access to resources.

D3-DENCR.name: Disk Encryption
D3-DENCR.desc: Encrypting a hard disk partition to prevent cleartext access to a file system.

D3-ET.name: Encrypted Tunnels
D3-ET.desc: Encrypted encapsulation of routable network traffic.

D3-FE.name: File Encryption
D3-FE.desc: Encrypting a file using a cryptographic key.

D3-MENCR.name: Message Encryption
D3-MENCR.desc: Encrypting a message body using a cryptographic key.

D3-ACH.name: Application Configuration Hardening
D3-ACH.desc: Modifying an application's configuration to reduce its attack surface.

D3-SFA.name: System File Analysis
D3-SFA.desc: Monitoring system files such as authentication databases, configuration files, system logs, and system executables for modification or tampering.

D3-ITF.name: Inbound Traffic Filtering
D3-ITF.desc: Restricting network traffic originating from untrusted networks destined towards a private host or enclave.

D3-SSC.name: Shadow Stack Comparisons
D3-SSC.desc: Comparing a call stack in system memory with a shadow call stack maintained by the processor to determine unauthorized shellcode activity.

D3-AH.name: Application Hardening
D3-AH.desc: Application Hardening makes an executable application more resilient to a class of exploits which either introduce new code or execute unwanted existing code. These techniques may be applied at compile-time or on an application binary.

D3-EHPV.name: Exception Handler Pointer Validation
D3-EHPV.desc: Validates that a referenced exception handler pointer is a valid exception handler.

D3-BA.name: Bootloader Authentication
D3-BA.desc: Cryptographically authenticating the bootloader software before system boot.

D3-DLIC.name: Driver Load Integrity Checking
D3-DLIC.desc: Ensuring the integrity of drivers loaded during initialization of the operating system.

D3-PSEP.name: Process Segment Execution Prevention
D3-PSEP.desc: Preventing execution of any address in a memory region other than the code segment.
